title: Tens of Thousands Executed: The Witch Hunts
story: [shocked] Imagine 60,000 innocent lives lost! Between 1450 and 1750, Europe was gripped by witch hunts fueled by paranoia. Get this: in 1589, the Pendle witch trials in England saw twelve accused, leading to ten executions. Entire communities turned against women, often scapegoated during crises. Fear of the unknown morphed neighbors into enemies. These hunts exposed societal fractures, where superstition reigned over reason. What if I told you fear can turn a village into a killing ground? The truth about humanity's dark side is chilling.
description: Over 60,000 lives claimed in the witch hunts fueled by fear and superstition. What happened to those innocent victims? #WitchHunts #History #PendleTrials
